I appreciated hearing from local members of the Corps and Holt & Atchison County officials. I will continue working with the state to make sure federal support is available where it‚Äôs needed & there are no federal hurdles holding up recovery efforts.

The most immediate need we have now is to rebuild levees & move forward on other recovery efforts. Our farms, highways, energy plants & small businesses are essential to our economy & ability to compete. We need to get them up & running as soon as possible.

After seeing the damage today, it is clear that plan needs to be looked at. The Corps should be prioritizing flood control, navigation, and drinking water. Environmental concerns are a part of that discussion, but the priority should always be on protecting people and property.

The flooding in Northwest Missouri has been completely catastrophic for a lot of families, farms & local infrastructure. For more than 15 years, I've said the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers‚Äô river management plan is not the right plan for Missouri.

In Holt and Atchison Counties this morning to survey the recent flood damage. Here are my thoughts on the situation:
